competitors.name: Microsoft Entra ID
competitors.notes: Formerly Azure AD, most significant competitor due to incumbency within Microsoft-using organizations, native identity solution for Microsoft services

competitors.name: Ping Identity
competitors.notes: Direct enterprise competitor with deep roots in on-premises, offers flexible deployment options for large enterprises with legacy systems

competitors.name: CyberArk
competitors.notes: Best for privileged access for admin accounts and critical systems

competitors.name: OneLogin
competitors.notes: Often described as 'Okta-lite', offers IAM essentials with simpler UI and faster time to value, more affordable pricing

competitors.name: JumpCloud
competitors.notes: Comprehensive cloud-based directory platform that centralizes identity, access, and device management

competitors.name: Rippling IT
competitors.notes: Emerging strong competitor with granular access controls across user lifecycle and holistic approach to global workforce management

competitors.name: Auth0
competitors.notes: Now owned by Okta, developer-focused authentication solution with extensive customization

competitors.name: SuperTokens
competitors.notes: Open-source authentication solution supporting various authentication methods including passwordless and social logins

competitors.name: Saviynt
competitors.notes: Advanced alternative for enterprises with strict compliance and security needs, offers fine-grained entitlement management

competitors.name: Duo Security
competitors.notes: Cisco-owned, best for MFA and device trust layered on top of SSO

context: In 2024, Okta remains a leader in identity and access management (IAM) but faces significant competition from Microsoft Entra ID due to its integration with the Microsoft ecosystem. Organizations commonly seek alternatives due to Okta's prohibitive pricing (especially for small businesses), complex initial setup requiring dedicated teams or consultants, and closed architecture that limits developer customization. The market is diverse with enterprise-level competitors (Microsoft, Ping, CyberArk), mid-market alternatives (OneLogin, JumpCloud), and developer-focused solutions (Auth0, SuperTokens).
